trans-unit.source: Call a custom API from an Android client | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Call a custom API from an Android client | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to define a custom API and then call it from an Android app that uses Microsoft Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to define a custom API and then call it from an Android app that uses Microsoft Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: Call a custom API from the client
trans-unit.target: Call a custom API from the client

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to call a custom API from an Android app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to call a custom API from an Android app.

trans-unit.source: A custom API enables you to define custom endpoints that expose server functionality that does not map to an insert, update, delete, or read operation.
trans-unit.target: A custom API enables you to define custom endpoints that expose server functionality that does not map to an insert, update, delete, or read operation.

trans-unit.source: By using a custom API, you can have more control over messaging, including reading and setting HTTP message headers and defining a message body format other than JSON.
trans-unit.target: By using a custom API, you can have more control over messaging, including reading and setting HTTP message headers and defining a message body format other than JSON.

trans-unit.source: The custom API created in this topic enables you to send a single POST request that sets the completed flag to true for all the todo items in your mobile service's table.
trans-unit.target: The custom API created in this topic enables you to send a single POST request that sets the completed flag to true for all the todo items in your mobile service's table.

trans-unit.source: Without this custom API, the client would have to send individual requests to update the flag for each todo item in the table.
trans-unit.target: Without this custom API, the client would have to send individual requests to update the flag for each todo item in the table.

trans-unit.source: You will add this functionality to the app that you created when you completed either the [Get started with Mobile Services] or the [Get started with data] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You will add this functionality to the app that you created when you completed either the [Get started with Mobile Services] or the [Get started with data] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete [Get started with Mobile Services].
trans-unit.target: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete [Get started with Mobile Services].

trans-unit.source: Now that you have created a custom API and called it from your Android app, consider finding out more about the following Mobile Services topics:
trans-unit.target: Now that you have created a custom API and called it from your Android app, consider finding out more about the following Mobile Services topics:

trans-unit.source: <html></html> Learn how to use the source control feature to more easily and securely develop and publish custom API script code.
trans-unit.target: <html></html> Learn how to use the source control feature to more easily and securely develop and publish custom API script code.
